data.text:
Georginio Wijnaldum is a Dutch professional footballer. He plays midfielder for Paris Saint-Germain in the Ligue 1 and the Netherlands national team.

During his prime, he was considered one of the best midfielders in the world.

You can follow Georginio Wijnaldum’s net worth, salary, earnings, contract, career, stats, girlfriend, and more here.

Georginio Wijnaldum’s Net Worth Details

As of 2024, Georginio Wijnaldum has a net worth of $35 million.

He played the 2022-23 season for Roma on loan and earned a €6.41 million yearly salary.

Salary and Contract

The Dutch midfielder’s prime source of earnings is his football contract. His estimated career earnings are €46,708 million from football salaries from the 2013 to 2022-23 season.

As of this writing, Wijnaldum has 1-year left on his contract with PSG, which will expire on 30 June 2024. His 1-year contract is worth €6.41 million.

Career Earnings

Season Team Salary (Gross) 2023-24 Paris Saint-Germain €6.41 million

Endorsement

Wijnaldum is an Adidas-endorsed player. He will wear the Adidas X Speedportal. 1 soccer cleats in the 2023-24 season.

About Georginio Wijnaldum

Full Name Georginio Gregion Emile Wijnaldum Current Club Paris Saint-Germain Position Midfielder Shirt No. – Date of Birth 11 November 1990 Age 32 Height 175 cm (5 ft 9 in) Birthplace Rotterdam, Netherland Nationality Dutch Net Worth $35 million Yearly Salary €6.41 million Outfitter Adidas Relationship Status In a Relationship Girlfriend Mirella Pereira Instagram @gwijnaldum

Georginio Gregion Emile Wijnaldum was born in Rotterdam, the Netherlands, on November 11, 1990. He is a Feyenoord youth academy product.

Club Career

Georginio Wijnaldum made his senior professional debut for Feyenoord in 2007 and played there from 2007 to 2011.

In 2011-12, he began playing regularly for PSV Eindhoven. He helped the club to win the Eredivisie title in 2014-15.

Wijnaldum joined Newcastle United in 2015 for one season. Then, he signed with Liverpool in 2016.

He won the Premier League title with Liverpool in 2019-20 and led the team to win the UEFA Champions League in 2018-19.

After five seasons at Liverpool, the Dutch player joined Paris Saint-Germain in 2021. In the 2021-22 season, he won the Ligue 1 title with PSG.

In 2022, the midfielder moved to Roma on loan and played their 2022-23 season. He played 14 matches and scored 2 goals.

International Career

Georginio Wijnaldum made his senior international debut for the Netherlands in 2011. He represented the Netherlands at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

In this World Cup, he played 7 matches and scored a goal for the Netherlands.

Girlfriend

The Dutch midfielder Wijnaldum’s girlfriend is Mirella Pereira. The couple met in 2017.

Career Stats

Season Comp. Team Match Goal 2022-23 Serie A Roma (loan) 14 2 2021_22 Ligue 1 Paris Saint-Germain 31 1 2020-21 Premier League Liverpool 38 2 2019-20 Premier League Liverpool 37 4

International Career: Netherlands

Year Match Goal 2011-Present 90 27

FAQs

Who is Georginio Wijnaldum, and what position does he play?

Georginio Wijnaldum is a Dutch professional footballer born in Rotterdam on November 11, 1990. He’s currently 33 years old and plays as a midfielder. He’s known for his versatility and can play as a central midfielder, attacking midfielder, or defensive midfielder. Wijnaldum is famous for his high work rate and impressive technical skills in the field.

What’s the deal with Wijnaldum’s name?

Interesting story! Wijnaldum was actually born as Georginio Boateng. When his parents divorced, he took his mother’s maiden name, Wijnaldum. So that’s why you might see him referred to as Boateng in some older records.

Which club does Georginio Wijnaldum currently play for?

As of the latest information, Wijnaldum plays for Al-Ettifaq FC in the Saudi Pro League. He joined the club on September 2, 2023, and his contract runs until June 30, 2026. He’s also the team captain.

Has Wijnaldum played for any big European clubs?

Oh yeah, he’s been around! Wijnaldum has played for several top clubs in Europe. He started his career with Feyenoord in the Netherlands, then moved to PSV Eindhoven. He played for Newcastle United in England and had a very successful stint with Liverpool. He also spent some time with Paris Saint-Germain in France before moving to Saudi Arabia.

What are some of Wijnaldum’s most significant achievements in club football?

Wijnaldum has won quite a few trophies. With Liverpool, he won the UEFA Champions League in 2019, the Premier League in 2020, and the FIFA Club World Cup. He also won the Eredivisie (Dutch league) with PSV Eindhoven and the KNVB Cup (Dutch Cup) with Feyenoord and PSV.

Has Georginio Wijnaldum played for the Netherlands national team?

Absolutely! Wijnaldum has been a key player for the Netherlands national team since 2011. He’s earned over 85 caps and has scored 26 goals for his country. He was part of the Dutch squad that finished third at the 2014 FIFA World Cup.

Does Wijnaldum have any family members who are also footballers?

Yes, football runs in the family! Wijnaldum has a younger brother, Giliano Wijnaldum, who also played professional football but has since retired. His half-brother, Rajiv van La Parra, plays for Almere City FC. And get this – his cousin is Royston Drenthe, who played for Real Madrid!

What’s Wijnaldum’s playing style like?

Wijnaldum is known for his versatility and all-around midfield play. He has great technical ability and vision and can contribute offensively and defensively. He’s particularly good at making late runs into the box and scoring goals from midfield. His high work rate and stamina are also key features of his game.

Has Wijnaldum won any individual awards?

Yes, he has! Wijnaldum was named Dutch Footballer of the Year for the 2014-2015 season when he played for PSV Eindhoven. This award recognized his outstanding performances, which helped PSV win the Eredivisie title.

What’s a fun fact about Wijnaldum’s early life?

Here’s an interesting tidbit: Wijnaldum wasn’t interested in football when he was young! His ambition was to become a gymnast or acrobat. It wasn’t until his cousin took him to Sparta Rotterdam’s opening day that he developed an interest in football. From there, he joined Sparta Rotterdam’s youth academy; the rest is history!
